body_html:
Sorry, do you mean instead of feeding the time in a tuple, feed it to the initializer? I think if we can do that, that should work.

I find feeding tuple input is a disaster anyway, it does't work with bidirectional_dynamic_rnn either, I had to write my own.

And it is the same problem when implementing other time variance RNNs, like this one https://www.ijcai.org/proceedings/2017/504

body:
Sorry, do you mean instead of feeding the time in a tuple, feed it to the initializer? I think if we can do that, that should work.

I find feeding tuple input is a disaster anyway, it does't work with bidirectional_dynamic_rnn either, I had to write my own. 

And it is the same problem when implementing other time variance RNNs, like this one https://www.ijcai.org/proceedings/2017/504
